title: Please allow 10 min surrenders in ARAM games
body: There are a ton of games where team comp decides it and waiting for the end is just obligatory time wasting.  Please?  :D

replies.body: If it takes up to 20 minutes, the team comp didn't decide it. ^^

I highly disagree. There are team comps that people literally stall the end of the game. They stand around the nexus while the enemy team is aced, and spam taunts, and dance. When the enemy team respawns they pull/dive kill them since they have such a huge advantage. They only end the game when they feel them losing that advantage. It's actually a real issue that should be punishable, or at the least allow a team to early surrender to end a game in that situation.
This is EXTREMELY rare to happen before 20 minutes.

It's not that rare. People will play without re-rolls, and get stuck with all Melee champs against a team with enough poke that they can't do anything but let them continue to push, and take turrets. Then there's the games where someone doesn't load in, or leaves/afks. I've seen plenty games end 8-12 minutes in because of these types of situations, and even more games stalled to 20 minutes by these teams with all the advantages just because they are enjoying being on the team that are untouchable.
well, if they dance just don't kill the creep and it's enough to lose, if you kill them it just show you team still want to fight so the surrender will probably fail

What if there was a mechanic, where if you are in the enemy base area (past 2nd turret) and taunt/laugh/dance while the nexus is FREELY open (all towers that protect it are destroyed), you get lasered and die with a doubled respawn time. (This is only during game, after the Nexus loses all of its health you can freely do it if you want).

As for not just hitting the nexus itself, that's tricky.  For all we know the enemy team gets into a team fight within the base and can't currently attack the nexus, or is busy attacking minions or something.  People will find a way to get past this, but at least it's just a suggestion.

~GL

I would be on board for 15 minute surrenders. 10 minutes is just too short to let it play out to see if there's any shot at a comeback/let your team scale (of course, I'm excluding AFKs/DCs). However, at 15 minutes, people should have at least one fully built item, if not 2 or more.

Really? I have had games where we win in less than 10 minutes, and games where at 10 minutes you are down 2 towers and 25 kills and all you want is for it to end, but then the other team just sits around spamming taunt or executing to your turrets while you are dead. Only one time in an ARAM have I ever seen a comeback after a team got a lead, they tend to either be dead even until somebody flinches, or they are totally one-sided from the start. I was playing WW, and at 15 minutes they were up to our nexus turrets and then I got a kill, got my team to pull themselves together and then won at 39 minutes. ON ARAM. It is certainly possible to make comebacks, and not everybody is going to immediately surrender at 10 minutes just because it is an option, but at least having the option would make a losing ARAM much less annoying and time wasting.

I play ARAM semi regularly and I see comebacks all the time. If a team that's tank heavy can stall out long enough they will usually come back and win. I have seen game after game where the enemies start BMing and then throw because of it. At the same time I would love a 10 minute surrender option for that game where the enemy team is Soraka, Sona, Kog'maw, Nid, and Varus.

I know that comebacks are possible, and my main point is that it would just be nice to have the *option* for a quicker surrender. Not that every game should have a surrender immediately at 10 minutes. I rarely surrender in ARAM, but having the option for those games where your teammates AFK and you CANNOT win would be excellent. I am anything but a quitter, but every now and then you just have to deal with the fact that your team is going to lose and their isn't any worth in wasting more time on that specific match.

I totally agree with the OP and Slaven.

It really does feel like 15-20 mins wasted, which I'm sure is not the goal of Riot's game play team (ie to make an ARAM match feel like a giant waste of time). It's not for lack of trying, our team fought hard, but there was just so winning it. The final kill score was like 12 to 50 or something crazy like that. NEED a mercy rule.  It's even worse when it's a 4 v 5.

Then there's always the nutbag who votes "no" to surrendering. Lord.

Ok, this is coming from a guy who has >2K games of ARAM on HA. No joke - I asked.

It's not a mentality thing or a bunch of trolls or people who give up too easy. Sometimes it's just a reality that no matter what you try or do, you are getting *completely stomped*.

If you are against Sona, Janna, Nid, Varus, and a tank - and you have like Eve, Yorick, J4, Braum and Aatrox....you are *probably* not going to have a good time. At a certain point, it's time to start the next match. If nobody is enjoying themselves (except the team wrecking face) then I fail to see the harm in a 10 minute surrender. ARAM is supposed to be fun, and in that particular case it isn't - why keep going?

- I highly doubt people would abuse it and surrender early. They'd get voted down anyway. Hell, people rarely vote yes even at 20 mins.
- It gives teams an out if they have a leaver/AFK. There are TONS of those in ARAM and it's a massive drag losing in slow motion for 20 mins because it's 4 v 5.

In general people are going to try their hardest to win or to compete. Even 4 v 5. But people are generally intelligent enough to know a lost cause when they see it. Why not give them the option to make their own decision about when to throw in the towel? What's the harm? Again, I highly doubt it would be abused.

OR - 

- balance Sona for God's sake
- find a better solution for ARAM afk/leavers


PS - On the other topic of failing to end the match: what if you disable taunt/dance/laugh inside the enemy base area/range? Make it less fun to drag it out needlessly and toxically.

10minutes is sometimes enough to know there is no chance. And the whole game is faster paced then SR, so it only fits that surrender be sooner.

I would agree with making the surrender time 15 minutes. ARAM is shorter than a normal 5v5, so it doesn't make sense to treat it like a longer one with surrender times. Applying the same surrender time as there is on 3v3 games makes sense.

I disagree honestly.  The number of games I've won after 15-20 minutes of just getting punished by poke is actually really high.  If the surrender timer were lower people would almost certainly give up in those games.  Plus, part of the fun in ARAM is playing the cards you're dealt to the best of your ability.  Sometimes you end up with a bunch of tanks and no damage, but even if they push you to your nexus turrets in 10 minutes there's still a lot of fun to be had in the last 10 mins or so duking it out to barely hold on.

I tend to have certain hopes that our team would win if we could just get past the Poking phase, what ARAM is basically about by now. And sometimes, we do win. Pushing all the way back from our destroyed Nexus turrets to their Nexus. It feels really good.

> There are a ton of games where team comp decides it

There's an alternative solution; a better ARAM champion balance. Yeah it's really difficult, or nigh-impossible, but it's what I really wish to see...
Totally agree! Fewer chances to come back.

If you get a poke heavy team with a melee heavy team, then having most of you taking an Orb of Winter trinket would elevate quite a bit.

15 minutes, *maybe*.  10 minutes, **no**.

If your inhibitor is under attack by Minute #9, you don't know how to play.  An all-poke team has the advantage until the 15-minute mark, when passive gold generation allows bruisers and tanks to be able to afford 2,500HP, 150 AR/MR builds.  Then the melee team starts rolling over the poke team because the carries can't burn down the bruisers/tanks before their 1400HP runs out.

It's all about the difference between being in the ARAM Bronze League™ and being 1800+ ARAM MMR.
